results.title: Born spastic
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and Spastic Society
results.brief_description: Unambiguously, the film explains cerebral palsy and shows various activities of handicapped people in England, including sheltered workshops and social clubs, like Joe’s Club, which caters not only for the handicapped, but their siblings as well. Both the handicapped and the people involved with them discuss some of the problems faced by the handicapped in England.

results.title: Born of fire
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, WQED and Linda Reavely
results.brief_description: Although the continents seem stationary, they are actually moving gradually each year. Follow scientists around the world as they search for clues to the causes of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. The video takes us to Iceland where new and recent volcanoes have emerged, and to Africa, Japan, California and Santorini to record what happens when the “plates” which make up the world’s surface move and crash together.

results.title: Born in fire
results.creator_credit: Shepherd Baker Studios, Woodside Petroleum Ltd and Guy Baskin
results.brief_description: Depicts the final stages of construction, as well as the tow, launch and placement of the substructure for the first offshore production platform for the North West Shelf Project. The aim of the project is to develop a natural gas field to supply power for domestic and industrial use in Perth and southwest Western Australia. Narrated by John Waters. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Born equal
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: Brief scenes are used to illustrate the meaning and purpose of the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights; that all people should be able to live their own lives as they desire with equality of opportunity, freedom of religion and speech, and with the tolerance of their fellow human beings. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Born different
results.brief_description: A documentary about the mentally handicapped children cared for at the Melbourne Kew Cottages. Founded in 1887 mainly owing to the campaigning of Dr J.V. McCleery, the Superintendant of the Kew Mental Hospital, the cottages are now one of the largest government institutions for the care and training of mentally handicapped children. Gives an unusual insight into this little-understood problem in talks with nurses who tell of the activities at the centre. Parents of handicapped children explain what these children have meant in their lives, and of the decision to send the youngsters to the cottages. Narrated by Gerald Lyons.

results.title: Born Chinese
results.brief_description: One quarter of the world’s population is Chinese, yet their habits and customs are little known. This is a story of a Chinese family and the life that surrounds them. They left China soon after the Revolution and now live in one of the huge government housing blocks in the thriving British colony of Hong Kong, where since the mass exodus from China it is possible to mingle with greater freedom than ever before with people born and brought up in China. Tells of their domestic, social, business, and cultural life. Narrated by Anthony Lawrence.

results.title: Boring for water in South Africa
results.brief_description: An instructional film showing procedures in drilling water bores in arid areas of South Africa, from the geological survey to the setting up and operation of the drill rig. Includes drill-bit sharpening, operation and erection of a windmill to pump out water.

results.title: Borgo a Mozzano
results.creator_credit: Report Films, Shell Film Unit and Michele Gandin
results.brief_description: During the last three thousand years the commune of Borgo a Mozzano in Tuscany has often been touched by history but somehow, now, it has stopped growing. As an experiment in raising the standard of living an agronomist was called in. But peasants are conservative and it takes time to win them over, but at last this was done and a new way of life began to unfold.

results.title: Borderline
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Grant McLean and Fergus McDonell
results.brief_description: A story of conflict and rebellion in a teenage girl that, to a large degree, typifies the problems of emotional adjustment experienced by many adolescents in their striving towards maturity. We meet Nora Fenton, a disturbed 15-year-old girl who, because of her persistent defiance of parental authority and self-injurious behavior, is sent to a remedial home for problem adolescents. As the film reviews Nora’s problems, we see how understanding, affection and firm parental guidance are th factors most needed in helping teenagers weather their most turbulent years.

results.title: Border weave
results.creator_credit: John Curthoys and Turner Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is a study of Scotland’s woollen industry, and, in particular, the weaving of the famous rainbow-hued Border cloth. From all over the world comes wool for Border looms to manufacture into the finest woollen cloth in the world. This film shows the processes in detail, from the preliminary grading and scouring of the wool, the careful blending of the brilliant colors for dyeing and the spinning of the yarn.
